alert.note: Alert for Whatcom (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 05 at 4:48PM PST until December 05 at 10:10PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stillaguamish River At Arlington affecting Snohomish County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... South Fork Stillaguamish River Near Jordan Rd. Bridge affecting Snohomish County. Nooksack River At North Cedarville affecting Whatcom County. .Rain will slowly taper off over night and move out of the area Wednesday. For the North West Region...including Saxon Bridge, North Cedarville, Ferndale, Burlington, Concrete, Mt. Vernon, Arlington, Jordan Rd. Bridge, Arlington...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...No flooding is currently forecast. * WHERE...Nooksack River at North Cedarville. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 145.6 feet. - Flood stage is 146.5 feet. - Forecast...The river crested near 146.9 this afternoon and fell below flood stage. It is expected to continue to fall but flooding will continue until the flood wave has passed downstream out of the area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1015 PM PST.
